meanings.definition: A very large, unspecified number or quantity.
meanings.sent1: There were squillions of stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: She had to count squillions of grains of sand on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The bakery made squillions of cookies for the holiday rush.
meanings.sent4: The forest was filled with squillions of chirping birds.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was overflowing with squillions of gold coins.

meanings.sent1: The library had squillions of books on its shelves.
meanings.sent2: He had to sort through squillions of emails in his inbox.
meanings.sent3: The amusement park had squillions of visitors during the summer.
meanings.sent4: The field was covered in squillions of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The city skyline was dotted with squillions of twinkling lights at night.
